N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 18 ยง 621.2 - Conditions for reimbursement for home relief

State Regulations
(a) Any claims for reimbursement which do not
reflect claims for home relief expenditures, including claims for reimbursement
under the emergency assistance for adults program, must not be claimed pursuant
to this Part. (b) Any claims for
reimbursement for assistance provided under a program or activity other than
the home relief program, or an activity authorized by the home relief program, which were not reimbursed and which were properly made at the time
reimbursement was originally claimed, may be claimed as home relief if they
could have been so claimed at the time the claims were originally submitted, provided that the claim is still timely and that an adjustment to reduce the
original claim is simultaneously submitted. (c) Any claims for reimbursement for home
relief which are subsequently determined by the department to be reimbursable
from, or for which reimbursement is actually received or credited from, another
program or activity or other source, must be reduced in an amount equivalent to
the amount determined by the department to be due from such other program, activity or source. (d) Claims for
reimbursement for home relief shall not be submitted for reimbursement if such
claims seek reimbursement at rates or amounts that are greater than rates or
amounts permitted by law. (e) Any
adjustments of claims for reimbursement shall be made in accordance with
procedures, instructions or directions of the department. Notes
